questions.question:
Answer the questions given below (refer Fig.2):


Fig. 2 Circuit diagram of three-phase bridge inverter


1. In a three-phase inverter operating in square wave mode, the output voltage waveform contains

answers.a: Both even and odd harmonics but no triplen harmonics

explanations.c: Explanation 3: The output contains odd harmonics (3<sup>rd</sup>, 5<sup>th</sup>, 7<sup>th</sup>, etc.) because a square wave is symmetric and lacks even harmonics. Triplen harmonics (3<sup>rd</sup>, 9<sup>th</sup>, 15<sup>th</sup>, etc.) cancel out in a balanced three-phase system.

questions.question: 2. The load voltage frequency is equal to

answers.c: Difference of carrier and reference signal frequency (f<sub>c</sub>-f<sub>r</sub>)
answers.d: Sun of carrier and reference signal frequency (f<sub>c</sub>+f<sub>r</sub>)

explanations.b: Explanation 2: In a three-phase inverter, the load voltage frequency is determined by the frequency of the reference signal.

questions.question: 3. The supply voltage is maintained constant in inverter by placing

answers.a: an inductor in series with the load
answers.b: capacitor in parallel to the load side
answers.c: capacitor in parallel to the supply side
answers.d: an inductor in parallel with the load

explanations.c: Explanation 3: The supply voltage in an inverter is typically maintained constant by placing a DC-link capacitor across the DC bus.

questions.question: 4. In a three-phase inverter, how many minimum number of switching devices are required?

explanations.c:
Explanation 3:
2 switches for Phase A (one for the upper side and one for the lower side).
2 switches for Phase B.
2 switches for Phase C.
Thus, the total number of switches required is:
2Ã—3=6 switches

questions.question: 5. The pulse width modulation control technique in inverters is used for

explanations.d: Explanation 4: The pulse width modulation (PWM) control technique in inverters is used to realize variable frequency variable output voltage.
